dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.5.4400
dataIdInfo.idPurp: This layer was created with the cartographic representation of New York's parks in mind, this data should not be used to represent the legal boundaies of property under parks jurisdiction or for analysis.
dataIdInfo.idAbs: This layer represents functional parkland. This is distinct from the parks property layer in that it only contains properties that are actively functioning as parks; the majority of lot and strip properties have been removed. Additionally, while the parks property layer represents the tax lot boundaries, this layer has snapped those boundaries to the nearest roadbed, shoreline, or fence line, in order to best cover the land area that is functioning as a park. Roads are included within large parks.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: When used, this data set must be accompanied with a citation that references the New York City Department of Parks and Recreation and the current date.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Unique identification number for each park property, identified by borough/county (B = Brooklyn; M = Manhattan; Q = Queens; R = Richmond (Staten Island); X = Bronx) and followed by a number.
Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
